block.p: Mary Meyer Pinkham, a daughter of Anne D. Pinkham and Richard A. R. Pinkham Jr. of Rye, N.Y., was married there yesterday to James Morley Lanza, the son of Jill E. Lanza and James P. Lanza of Mamaroneck, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel O'Reilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection.

Mrs. Lanza, 27, teaches English at Rye Neck High School. She graduated from New York University and received a master's degree in education from Manhattanville College. Her father, who until November was the managing director for marketing at the International Speedway Corporation in Daytona Beach, Fla., now works in Rye as a marketing consultant to media companies, sports sanctioning bodies and corporate clients.

Mary Meyer Pinkham, a daughter of Anne D. Pinkham and Richard A. R. Pinkham Jr. of Rye, N.Y., was married there yesterday to James Morley Lanza, the son of Jill E. Lanza and James P. Lanza of Mamaroneck, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Oâ€™Reilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection.

Mary Meyer Pinkham, a daughter of Anne D. Pinkham and Richard A. R. Pinkham Jr. of Rye, N.Y., was married there yesterday to James Morley Lanza, the son of Jill E. Lanza and James P. Lanza of Mamaroneck, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel O'Reilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection.

Mrs. Lanza, 27, teaches English at Rye Neck High School. She graduated from New York University and received a master's degree in education from Manhattanville College. Her father, who until November was the managing director for marketing at the International Speedway Corporation in Daytona Beach, Fla., now works in Rye as a marketing consultant to media companies, sports sanctioning bodies and corporate clients.
Mr. Lanza, also 27, is an electrical contractor in Mamaroneck for Lanza Electrical Contracting Corporation, of which his father was a founder.
